channel.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
channel.description:
I live with a brother who has an extremely rare chromosome abnormality. I just started a blog that I will update every day about living with him. It would be greatly appreciated if the members of MITB would follow it and help me out. Thank you, and the link is in my signature.
UPDATE: Why, my good friend Cooper has pointed out my stupidity! I must fix it right now. /sarcasm
[quote="cooper"]According to Andrew, "my mother had him at a late age - causing him to be born from an old egg that had spoiled over the years."[/quote]
Well son, you see - women have EGGS, and when your daddy ejaculates inside your mommy, his sperm swims through her vagina and attaches to the egg. As a women gets older, so does her eggs! Magnificent! As her eggs get older they are more prone to growing problems such as the abnormality my brother was born with.
Next time if your going to correct me at least have passed 9th grade or sex ed.
UPDATE: New post. Same dosage of medications but different mood today.
[quote="la­wl"][quote author=T4_ link=topic=373689.msg2818941#msg2818941 date=1244469487] [quote author=jme link=topic=373689.msg2818757#msg2818757 date=1244442389] I just saw this exact same thread on 4chan..
? [/quote] [/quote] someone, from this forum, posted it there.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 08, 2009, 11:34:25 am[/size][hr][quote author=Lothy link=topic=373689.msg2818867#msg2818867 date=1244458867] [quote] Stephen was only a little pain in my ass today. He is starting to be exceptionally annoying, and all day has been repeating the same phrases. To a person first meeting Stephen, it may seem funny. After hearing the same thing for 24 hours straight, you want to tie him to the wall and kick the shit out of him. [/quote] Very distasteful. [/quote] so? i love how people here are all like 'omg i am so morally correct,' pretty sure if you were in his position you would feel the same[/quote] Haha thanks man. Yeah, most people don't understand. I didn't expect everyone to.
Update: Because of all the flaming I am recieving, I edited my first post as I was very pissed at him, and explained his abnormality and symptoms.

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:62, topic:282790”]I think it’d be worthwhile to continue the blog, however I think you should make it something a bit more interesting than ‘My brother annoyed me much today’. I think it would be nice if you could perform and detail the results of a few experiments on him. For example, if you showed him this image, http://img188.imageshack.us/img188/802/cog2.png , how quickly would he notice the square that doesn’t fit in? This kind of thing. It’s kind of hard to find information about these people, because their caretakers usually take the stance that most people here have taken - that it’s something that should be kept private. But I’m really interested in trying to understand how this guy thinks.

However, you’re doing something that is going to seem uncomfortable to many people. To make it go most smoothly, I suggest you try to remain as ‘perfect’ as possible. For example, you’ve already gotten picked on for something as trivial as a spelling mistake. Alot of people are going to become self appointed “Internet police” around you, (Some will probably send you hate messages and threats), so it’s advisable to remove any information that could be used to personally identify you. Of course, make no hesitation on banning/ignoring these people.

Then again, you’ve probably figured all this out already. So in summary, please keep it updated, I’ll read :)[/quote]

That actually isn’t a bad idea

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:61, topic:282790”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=373689.msg2818596#msg2818596 date=1244429687]
you should poison him
[/quote]

Trolling him is on par to flame.[/quote]
what? i was being serious.
simplest way to kill him, and little chance of getting caught

Read full topic

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I think it’d be worthwhile to continue the blog, however I think you should make it something a bit more interesting than ‘My brother annoyed me much today’. I think it would be nice if you could perform and detail the results of a few experiments on him. For example, if you showed him this image, http://img188.imageshack.us/img188/802/cog2.png , how quickly would he notice the square that doesn’t fit in? This kind of thing. It’s kind of hard to find information about these people, because their caretakers usually take the stance that most people here have taken - that it’s something that should be kept private. But I’m really interested in trying to understand how this guy thinks.

However, you’re doing something that is going to seem uncomfortable to many people. To make it go most smoothly, I suggest you try to remain as ‘perfect’ as possible. For example, you’ve already gotten picked on for something as trivial as a spelling mistake. Alot of people are going to become self appointed “Internet police” around you, (Some will probably send you hate messages and threats), so it’s advisable to remove any information that could be used to personally identify you. Of course, make no hesitation on banning/ignoring these people.

Then again, you’ve probably figured all this out already. So in summary, please keep it updated, I’ll read

@lawl wrote:

Greeny:

You’re only going to get flamed for your opinions here because no-one knows what is like to be you, and no can understand your situation - so speak to someone who does know what it’s like and who can understand! Avoid more anguish.

thats not true, i didnt flame him

item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:57, topic:282790”]I wouldn’t want to put a sibling in a home. Love by definition is absolute, you could love him while disliking his actions at times. Consequently disliking him now and then, but still loving him all the time irrespective.

I’m not questioning your relationship with him, nor the trouble he causes you. It is you who constantly brings up these issues, which just re-enforces the point of my previous post.

Greeny:

I’m eager to know what your ulterior motives are because I cannot see any motivation to do this other than for sympathy or attention.

You claim it’s not for sympathy, yet you’re constantly practically begging for it. I’m not having a go at you, I am trying to help you. It’s understandable that you want sympathy for your life because of your brother, and the fact he obviously gets a lot more attention than you is possibly hurting you - so you proclaim this other the internet in order to seek attention and sympathy from strangers.

My advice, if this is truly the case (and you don’t need to admit it here if you don’t want to), is that you seek help. Talk to your parents about it, they wont mind, it’s not like they’re not used to having troubles and they probably have had similar thoughts. Family and friends will empathise better than strangers.

You’re only going to get flamed for your opinions here because no-one knows what is like to be you, and no can understand your situation - so speak to someone who does know what it’s like and who can understand! Avoid more anguish.

Please don’t “state any more points” to me, because the last one had absolutely nothing to do with my post at all. To me it was just a cry for help.[/quote]
That left me speechless.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I wouldn’t want to put a sibling in a home. Love by definition is absolute, you could love him while disliking his actions at times. Consequently disliking him now and then, but still loving him all the time irrespective.

I’m not questioning your relationship with him, nor the trouble he causes you. It is you who constantly brings up these issues, which just re-enforces the point of my previous post.

I'm eager to know what your ulterior motives are because I cannot see any motivation to do this other than for sympathy or attention.

You claim it’s not for sympathy, yet you’re constantly practically begging for it. I’m not having a go at you, I am trying to help you. It’s understandable that you want sympathy for your life because of your brother, and the fact he obviously gets a lot more attention than you is possibly hurting you - so you proclaim this other the internet in order to seek attention and sympathy from strangers.

My advice, if this is truly the case (and you don’t need to admit it here if you don’t want to), is that you seek help. Talk to your parents about it, they wont mind, it’s not like they’re not used to having troubles and they probably have had similar thoughts. Family and friends will empathise better than strangers.

You’re only going to get flamed for your opinions here because no-one knows what is like to be you, and no can understand your situation - so speak to someone who does know what it’s like and who can understand! Avoid more anguish.

Please don’t “state any more points” to me, because the last one had absolutely nothing to do with my post at all. To me it was just a cry for help.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:55, topic:282790”]You do realise that men produce sperm so fast that many will be deformed, ie double tailed, no tail etc etc. To suggest women are the cause of most genetic disorders is quite odd.

Also, I recall seeing somewhere you did not perceive this as a disease, it is. Unfortunately it is a genetic disease, and I find it rather distasteful to be venting frustration in this way.

All this bullshit about letting emotions out is irrelevant. You could see a counsellor or discuss it with your parents or friends. Publicly sharing the information across the internet is, in my opinion, shameful and exploitation. I’m eager to know what your ulterior motives are because I cannot see any motivation to do this other than for sympathy or attention.

EDIT: I’d be more understanding if you didn’t talk about wanting to beat the shit out of your disabled brother.[/quote]

I think you would be mad at someone sometimes if you lived your childhood in fear of being attacked, had your valuables destroyed, and having friends afraid to go to your house.
Just stating a point.
You think everyone in my family loves him all the time?
No. It doesn’t work like that. It’s my mom’s decision to put him in a group home, not mine.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You do realise that men produce sperm so fast that many will be deformed, ie double tailed, no tail etc etc. To suggest women are the cause of most genetic disorders is quite odd.

Also, I recall seeing somewhere you did not perceive this as a disease, it is. Unfortunately it is a genetic disease, and I find it rather distasteful to be venting frustration in this way.

All this bullshit about letting emotions out is irrelevant. You could see a counsellor or discuss it with your parents or friends. Publicly sharing the information across the internet is, in my opinion, shameful and exploitation. I’m eager to know what your ulterior motives are because I cannot see any motivation to do this other than for sympathy or attention.

EDIT: I’d be more understanding if you didn’t talk about wanting to beat the shit out of your disabled brother.

Read full topic

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Andrew, post:42, topic:282790”][quote author=cooper link=topic=373689.msg2819871#msg2819871 date=1244515959]
According to Andrew, “my mother had him at a late age - causing him to be born from an old egg that had spoiled over the years.”
[/quote]

You know how a baby is born right? Or has sex ed not happened yet?[/quote]
What? You said you will post how it happened, but you didn’t, so I quoted you from your blog. Of course I know how a baby is born, and I took sex ed many years ago.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Eggs don’t ‘spoil’ like a chicken egg in your fridge would.

It’s a metaphor. As a woman ages, her oocytes age with her, and after age 40, it is generally not recommended to conceive because the chances of a genetic disorder are higher because of the egg aging.

Moparisthebest:

it is not anyone’s fault and no one should be blamed for it.

Yes, his parents should be blamed for it, because it is their fault. Any competent ob/gyn would recommend against it due to her age, and any competent parent would heed that advice.

Moparisthebest:

Everyone has problems with their siblings, some have it worse then others but decent people don’t make fun of their sibling’s disability online.

Nowhere on that site do I see him saying “LOAlaoloLoLolo My BRo R Fukin Dum Lol!” He is using the internet as a expressive medium to help him cope with the stress his brother creates. He talks about how annoying his brother is so he can let some of the emotion out. I don’t see anything wrong with that.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

According to Andrew, “my mother had him at a late age - causing him to be born from an old egg that had spoiled over the years.”

You know how a baby is born right? Or has sex ed not happened yet?
[/quote]

Eggs don’t ‘spoil’ like a chicken egg in your fridge would. You don’t seem to grasp the fact that how he got the way he is doesn’t matter, it is not anyone’s fault and no one should be blamed for it. Everyone has problems with their siblings, some have it worse then others but decent people don’t make fun of their sibling’s disability online.[/quote]
where do you see anyone making fun of his brother? its just about how annoying he is

I laugh every time. Does this make me a bad person?

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

You still didn’t have to write something about your brother annoyin you.

I have 3 brothers they really piss me off.

1 of them is very sensitive cries if he call him a name, wtf?

1 is a fatass and plays video games all day.

My other is a baby who cries to death, help pl0x?

So please don’t complain about your problems you should just help yourself and maybe if you tried to help him he may not be such a bother.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Andrew Andrew
item.description:
@Andrew wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:46, topic:282790”]pics or gtfo.

EDIT: [quote author=Unhandled link=topic=373689.msg2820118#msg2820118 date=1244546949]
You realize eggs don’t just sit around for years on end right? There is either a new one each month, or there isn’t one at all.
[/quote]
The primary oocytes sit around until they undergo meiosis and an ovum is released, hence why Down’s etc. tends to happen more when children are born to older mothers. He is correct in his statement about “spoiled eggs.”[/quote]

Finally someone else who knows their shit

A women is born with eggs that some will sit with her throughout her for her entire life- she doesn’t make new eggs.
This is why Men rarely ever contribute to the chromosome abnormality - our sperm is always renewed.

Read full topic
item.source: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Why should I care about your retarded brother? Why should I sympathize with someone that asks for it? If you hate your brother, either kill yourself, kill your brother or just leave. If you aren’t up for that, you don’t really hate him and you just want attention.

Read full topic

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

pics or gtfo.

EDIT: [quote=“Unhandled, post:45, topic:282790”]You realize eggs don’t just sit around for years on end right? There is either a new one each month, or there isn’t one at all.[/quote]
The primary oocytes sit around until they undergo meiosis and an ovum is released, hence why Down’s etc. tends to happen more when children are born to older mothers. He is correct in his statement about “spoiled eggs.”

item.title: Check out my blog about living with my (abnormal) brother
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Andrew:

If you lived with him you would understand, and I have big anger problems.

Yeah, we’ve realised that you have big anger problems as we here at this forum have already felt the full force of it.

Yes, now back to ‘constructive criticism’. I don’t like it how you’re so mad at your brother who has unfortunately got a rare disease which is not his fault and not what he wanted but that’s for you to decide and not me because I don’t know how it feels to be someone in your position.

Read full topic
